entry.title: Deploying to GitHub
entry.content: This blog will need to eventually be hosted somewhere. There are many places that allow you to host a small blog for free. GitHub, Gitlab, and Netlify seem to be the go-to places, so I will begin by trying GitHub. I want to get the hang of the process involved in publishing a Hugo blog.

entry.title: You have to start somewhere
entry.content:
Hey there! This is a test post and probably will not be published

Looking at various Hugo Hugo Themes . I decided to go with one named Axiom . It looks simple, it's configurable, and seems to load fast. It reminds me a bit of Medium. Good enough. Time to configure it.

Sometimes it's usefult to quote things.

You can trade hours for dollars or ideas for millions.

— Cactus Jack on The Shark Tank

There are also shortcodes for buttons with icons.

Note: The icon parameter value must match one of the filenames at /layouts/partials/svg/. You can add more files by creating the same directory structure in project root. Be sure to add the same markup to the opening <svg> tag in each file.

Click me to download

And emojis are included as well üëç

Emojis are easy to add and are fully supported. You can even use emoji shortcodes like :emoji_name: to place a üç∫ on the page. Just have to make sure that enableEmoji = true is set in config.toml

How about a little bit of code:

Bash:

#!/usr/bin/env bash

echo "Hello World!"

Python:

#!/usr/bin/env python3

print(f"Hello World!")

Embedding YouTube videos

Similar to tweets Hugo provides a shortcode for YouTube as well. Videos can be embedded using youtube.
